author: MrOH
title: My local GPs are amazing but I have problems getting an appointment
body:
My local GP's at Woodbrooke Medical Practice are amazing, especially Dr Devlin who is so attentive and compassionate. The poor patient experience comes as a result of the booking system for appointment and lack of understanding from some reception staff.  
A recent change is the requirement to phone at 9am each morning to secure an appointment with GP and I explained that it is difficult due to work pattern. I have tried unsuccessfully on 3 occasions this week. The system to book online is also unavailable to me as the reception staff did not have the paperwork available for registration.  
So stressful and disappointing as when you do get to see a GP they are exemplary.

author: Proud oarent
title: Palliative care for our  daughter
body: The whole team and I do mean everyone are just amazing. To say they go the extra miles is an understatement they just think of everything. We just can’t thank them enough and no words can express how we feel about it.

readBy.name: Office of Monica Lennon, MSP for Central Scotland
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: LMM1816
title: Forever grateful to the full team.
body:
I gave birth to my beautiful baby in December 2019 at Forth Valley Hospital.  
I was admitted to the labour ward, nervous and unsure as this was my first time in labour. I shouldn't have been, i had the most amazing experience and was completely overwhelmed with the quality of care that I received. The staff were amazing before, during my labour and after. My midwife Erin was the best and made me feel so safe and at ease. I am so grateful to everyone in the maternity ward and will forever sing the praise of this fantastic team. With everything going on in the world, I just wanted them to know how much we appreciate them looking after us at our most vulnerable. I will remain forever grateful to the full team.

author: 64cc
title: Neglecting a patient's needs.
body:
My daughter had been badly abused by her ex partner, police were called and she was taken to Arbroath A&E, she was not seen by medical staff because she was confused after being knocked out, I made an appointment for her to be seen by her GP surgery later the same day.  
The doctor who said nothing about her huge swollen neck, the broken teeth, examined her mouth, asked her to join her bottom teeth with her top teeth and said there wasn't much wrong with the alignment. They didn't mention her broken teeth but asked what dentist she was with. I mentioned that my daughter was in a lot of pain and when told we had nothing but paracetamol to use for this, a prescription for codeine was written out.  
We attended the dentist appointment a few days later who said my daughter should attend the maxillofacial unit at Ninewells hospital Dundee as an emergency patient. The doctor who examined her said there was definitely something wrong and that we had to make our own way to the dental hospital in Dundee for x-rays.  
We found out that my daughter had a broken mandible on the right side and also a fracture on the left hand side of the mandible, she was asked to stay overnight for surgery the next day my daughter felt she couldn't do this but arranged to come back the following day for surgery and this is what she did. Wires were put in.  
Things have went from bad to worse when we attend this surgery now because I already tried to report what happened initially and on other dates for removal of stitches and because of problems with constant infections. I'm constantly being asked what I think should happen when we attend for appointments now. It's as if we're being blamed for the neglect that happened in the first place and how dare I report it. We attended Arbroath Infirmary on more than one occasion because constant infections only to be told there was nothing wrong with the incision and the weeping was normal.  
There is more to this story and from doctors who we felt turned this around and onto the patient and her family, to nurses telling me I'd do any for my child but not explaining what they mean. When did it become normal for doctors to treat people who have been abused like this?

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Gastronightmare
title: Part good part bad
body: The gastro and liver unit at royal Cornwall hospital is a challenging ward for the staff and the nurses are evidently working super hard on the ward. The nursing, care and domestic staff were brilliant. Unfortunately one member of staff was particularly rude, uncommunicative and generally not very pleasant to deal with! This made understanding the ongoing care arrangements difficult as it was difficult to ask them any questions without feeling like causing a nuisance. Their general attitude made them very difficult to engage with.

author: newmumeac
title: C section
body: Majority of staff at the RAH were fantastic. Upbeat and very helpful. Only exception was one member of staff. Tried to put me off my elective section and made me feel pretty rubbish. It was all agreed with the consultant prior that I was getting a section having had one previously. On the day however they spent a while trying to put me off with a breech baby! I felt their attitude was pretty stinking which was a shame as all the other staff were lovely.

author: Debs R
title: The amazing care I have received
body:
I was admitted to Inverclyde Royal Hospital yesterday with varying symptoms that have been on going for two months and quite unexplainable.  
From my own GP Dr Royal’s great care and persistence on getting me the right medical help straight through to the absolutely wonderful medical team at J North at the IRH.  
I was very worried about being admitted to hospital during the pandemic but from the minute I arrived the medical team alleviated my fears. The standard of cleaning and wiping I witnessed was incredible. However, the attention and professionalism I received was second to none. They moved at speed to get me tests and results to ensure they knew as quickly as possible what they were dealing with. They didn’t stop moving at such a fast pace the entire time I was in that ward. Despite the ward being full their care for me as an individual was just incredible.  
Despite all of the NHS putting themselves at risk on the front line for people like me on a daily basis, they just never stop sharing their care about everyone no matter the ailment.  
I think all of the NHS are fantastic, but I would like to say that all the staff on J North were second to none and make a great cuppa to calm nerves.  
Thank you Clare and all of the team at J North, IRH, I appreciated everything you done.

author: No name provided
title: A warm and friendly environment
body:
My Mum had been ill for around a year and was in constant pain. She came in for a bone marrow biopsy at the Haematology Clinic with Jane who was assisted by a trainee nurse.  
I cannot stress enough how amazing Jane was throughout the procedure. I was allowed into the room to support my nervous Mum, Jane thoroughly explained everything she was doing to Mum, she kept me in the loop and ensured she was continuing to train, explain and support the trainee all at the same time. It was a warm and friendly environment and we did not feel there was a rush to leave until we were ready.  
I really appreciated the great service provided and am very thankful for the organised and efficient manner used to treat my Mum.  
Thank you so much.

author: Steak Pie and Mash
title: a positive experience
body: In 2019 I saw Dr Yeoman at Bourtreehill Medical Practice for mental health problems I was experiencing. I want to say thank you because although I was not in a healthy mental state at the time, Dr Yeoman treated me with respect and had such a lovely and genuine way of treating me at the appointment. I am on medication now and so much happier, more confident and content inside. That first step going to a warm, helpful and professional doctor makes all the difference in your journey and I don't forget these things or take them for granted. Thank you!

author: Fifi77
title: A massive thank you
body:
Just wanted to say a massive thank you to all the doctors, nurses and AHPs who looked after my mum in ward 2C at Crosshouse Hospital over the last 3 weeks. The last place she needed to be was in a hospital environment and I was extremely anxious that she wld potentially pick up not only covid, but another hospital acquired infection. Thankfully she sailed through her operation and the post op period but that is testimnent to all of you! Glad to have her home and feeling better than she was before she went in!  
Thank you so much! Xx

author: Az90
title: Stepping stones
body: I have been going to Inclusion since November when I started I was not judged by anyone and felt comfortable to talk with everyone. My group has been a real help in my journey through what I would call hell. My worker in my group has helped me understand my problem better and understand how to control my alcoholism better. I would recommend this for anyone who suffers from a addiction.

author: patient 21
title: Waited so long for an appointment
body:
Waited so long for an appointment and it ended up being unhelpful and patronising  
I waited several months for an appointment after experiencing pelvic pain and nausea everyday for months and when I finally got an appointment the person I saw was rude and dismissive. They asked me very basic questions and then decided it wasn’t their departments problem, when I am certain it definitely is a gynaecology issue. When I asked for any help/advice, they said that I cannot expect them to do everything. Which has left me back at square one.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: MAPQ
title: Words can’t express how impressed I was
body: Massive thanks to the A& E team at Wishaw, and apologies for taking up crucial time having to deal with my fall (probably a glass of wine too much! ) and issue (facial cuts, needing stitching). NHS Scotland have so much to care about, that my stupidity seems ridiculously at this time. But my very dearest and sincere thanks to one and all for dealing with my issue. Words can’t express how impressed I was by the care & attention given. Thank you. And thank you.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: KR1812
title: I cannot praise all of your staff enough
body: My son broke his arm this week and I just wanted to post about how fantastic our treatment was from start to finish. We arrived at A& E and were triaged within minutes. A lovely nurse practitioner Jill then saw us and took care of us for our whole visit. I was slightly apprehensive about being in a hospital at this time but she reassured us. Linda and another lady who put his cast on were like a comedy act and kept my 7 year old smiling and laughing through a painful time. Due to going for several x-ray’s etc we were moving about the hospital and genuinely every member of staff we encountered checked we were ok and asked if we knew where we were going etc. I cannot praise all of your staff enough. My son is currently selling sweetie boxes to raise money for a donation to the A& E department as a thank you. We’ll deliver it soon x

author: Guddi
title: My road to recovery
body:
My road to recovery from work related anxiety & depression with the help of Lets Talk Employment Support Services  
I was suffering from anxiety & depression due to work related issues when my doctor suggested contacting the Lets Talk counselling service. I filled in the form given to me by the doctor and sent it off. I attended CBT training sessions & also had support from the Employment Support Service.  
The CBT sessions were brilliant & I gained useful tools which enabled me to change my mind set regarding how to cope with stress & anxiety. There was one particular session of CBT which talked about perfectionism. It was a eureka moment for me as I realized these traits in myself. Suddenly a I felt a load had been lifted from my shoulders! As a result of this CBT session I changed my mindset which in turn improved my well being immensely.  
Alongside the CBT sessions I had regular contact with Sanpreet, one of the employment support advisors. This regular contact via the phone was invaluable! Sanpreet spoke to me & guided me when I was at a really low point. Sanpreet was brilliant and the advise she was able to provide regarding employment issues helped me enormously on my road to recovery.  
The Employment Support Service, alongside the CBT counselling, has been really beneficial and I am pleased to say that I am on the road to recovery.  
It has been a long journey, approx 18 months, but I am much better now thanks to all the support I received from the Lets Talk service.  
I am grateful to my doctor for informing me of the Lets Talk service. I am also grateful for the CBT training I received and am especially grateful to Sanpreet from the Employment Support services.  
Long may you all continue to provide this vital service!  
Kind regards.  
r. XX

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: CL24
title: Induction of labour
body: I was in and out of day bed unit from 37 weeks because of high blood pressure, the midwifes made me feel so at home even with coronavirus pandemic. I was then induced in ward 23 where the staff were absolutely faultless they made me feel so relaxed as it took two days for my induction to work, once I went into labour the midwife and students done an amazing job of looking after me and my son! I really can’t fault any of them. Once I was discharged I had to attend triage the week after giving birth because I had high blood pressure, the staff knew me well by this point and I really can say they done there best too look after me and get me better. They really are unsung heroes and even more so during this pandemic nothing is a bother!

author: David07855
title: My event stay in hospital ward B18
body:
Felt very good after the operation, but I feel that the menu choices I made contributed to a slightly longer stay than was anticipated by the consultant. Maybe I should have investigated what type of foods I should have eaten immediately after the surgery. By not being careful I feel that I contributed to several bouts of sickness about when I would usually have been discharged.  
The situation was quickly resolved by a conversation with Ann-Marie, a member of the dietician team. I have been able to ask for potato mash and gravy, or a jacket potato, a simple solution. From then on I have been looking forward to the meals which have to be low fibre for the first week or so.  
The standard menus are very tempting, but we’re not appropriate for my condition.  
The nursing and support staff have been absolutely wonderful and are continuing to make my stay with you quite a pleasure, even though it will be nice to go home. What a marvellous caring team you have. So thank you all for taking the time to adjust my diet and enable my recovery

readBy.name: Warrington and Halton Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Npton2020
title: The care from midwives
body: Gave birth to my little boy in February this year and I can honestly say I had the best care from two of Northampton generals hospitals loveliest midwives (Holly & Lauren). They were truly amazing and I felt truly blessed to have them in what was a very emotional yet wonderful experience. A special thanks to Jade (support worker) who helped me in trying to find the best way to feed my baby, offer advice and making me feel comfortable whilst I was in hospital for a few days. The three of them went above and beyond and are a real credit to the team. The kindest of the ladies doing our 12 and 20 week scan, the couple of emergency appointments I had in between too and the appointments following the birth of our baby - nothing is too much trouble and they all put you at ease.

author: Superhero60
title: I have received amazing support
body:
Emergency surgery & staff with disabilities and long term health conditions  
I'm a member of staff in Bo'ness Community Hospital. Towards the end of last year I became acutely unwell at work and required emergency bowel surgery.  
The staff in Bo'ness were fantastic and started a basic assessment while we waited for the ambulance, everyone kept me calm and reassured.  
During my stay in fvrh I received excellent care from Ms Cannings and her surgical team, the ICU staff and the staff in B11.  
The team I want to thank the most the most is the staff in Bo'ness Ward One! As a staff member with various long term health conditions I have received amazing support from scn Cherise & dcn Lynn. Every step of the way their priority has been my own safety and wellbeing.  
I would also like to thank my colleagues who have supported my shifts during my phased return and again during the covid-19 pandemic. Due to my own health conditions I am currently shielding at home and my work family have been nothing but supportive and accommodating.

author: CharmB76
title: Dental Treatment for my daughter following a trauma
body:
My daughter suffered a terrible fall at the age of 8, breaking her front tooth severely. Our dentist referred us to the Dental Hospital in Glasgow where we proceeded to have approximately 8 years of treatments in an effort to save the root, save what was left of the tooth, and help my daughter who, despite always being brave, had suffered emotionally through the trauma and endless treatments.  
Having grown into a young teenager, she was extremely self-conscious, refusing to smile and show her teeth. Dr Burns at Glasgow Dental Hospital personally took over the treatments and, having children herself, understood how vulnerable my daughter was at the age of 16. The final outcome is as close to perfect as we could have asked for, and I would like to extend my sincere appreciation and heartfelt thanks to Dr Burns and her team for all she did for my daughter over the past few years. I put my trust in her and today my daughter smiles her beautiful smile and laughs openly, and there is nothing more beautiful. Thank you Dr Burns! !

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: debz4711
title: Out of hours dental treatment
body:
I just wanted to share my experience of NHS out of hours dental care. Last weekend, I had excruciating toothache so I contacted 111 for advice. The call handler was very thorough and transferred me to a dental nurse. She did an assessment, gave me self care advice and advised that I’d be contacted by a dentist the following day. The dentist contacted me, prescribed antibiotics and forwarded the prescription to my local pharmacy. This treatment worked well for a few days but unfortunately, the pain came back the following weekend.  
Yesterday, I contacted 111 for advice. The call handler was very kind and again, very thorough. I was triaged by a dental nurse and an appointment was arranged for a telephone consultation with another dentist. The dentist decided I should have a physical examination and arranged an appointment at my local out of hours dentist within the hour. I attended my appointment, had an x-ray and removal of my wisdom tooth. I received follow up care advice from the dentist and dental nurse, both of whom could not have been more helpful and friendly. From the car park attendants at the Royal Alexandra Hospital in Paisley, to the reception staff, to the domestics, the care assistants and the dental staff, everyone was so incredibly helpful.  
The service I received from every single member of the NHS team was exceptional. Even on weekends and bank holidays, during a global pandemic, our NHS workers continue to provide essential services with the utmost professionalism, efficiency and kindness. I have nothing but respect and gratitude for the treatment I received and the incredible work carried out by our NHS workers every day. Thank you to each and every one of you 😀

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Miss DMU
title: Video Appointment with Pain Management Clinic
body:
Got a phone call to ask if I would like to wait for a face to face or if I would like to have a Video appointment earlier last week (my first appt since being on the waiting list). I elected (having understood I may need Face to Face) to have my initial Pain Mgt Clinic Appt via Video.  
I received all the information, did the test call & today accessed the Appt with a lovely Female Registrar Dr Nagaraja (apologies I didn't get to write her full name down), It was great having a female. I had a good, focused, no noise, no waiting or travelling (being in pain or knowing you can have a bad day without warning knowing I wouldn't have to travel made things easier), appointment, I was able to listen to the questions, answer them, have time to explain, definitely a more focused appointment, I know not for everyone but I certainly felt more comfortable especially as my husband didn't have to take time off work to take me etc.  
The Registrar was brilliant, put me at ease, explained & reflected back. Yes I will need a face to face but the medical history, my concerns & expectations etc have all been done. So my hope will be next appt will be focused more on the next steps.

author: Zelda1980
title: Shoulder out of place
body: My shoulder come out of place whilst doing garden. The care and ❤️ I was shown was amazing. And I was made to feel like I was important to staff. Who all asked me why I stayed in pain for so long without calling an ambulance. I told them I didnt want to call ambulance. Incase ambulances were needed for Corona patients. And they told me. Next time I have emergency to call ambulance straight. Cause they were there for me too. I am alone with hardly any family. So be told I was important to them too. Made me cry tears of joy. Because I didn't feel alone anymore. There is no real way to thank NHS staff. For putting there lives in danger everyday. To be there to help people. Especially people like me who are alone and have no real support. Thanks to All nurses and Doctors in the world. ❤️❤️❤️❤️😄😄 From Julie Spence

author: Rocket Ron
title: Top quality service and care
body:
Top quality service and care at Borders General Hospital A&E Department  
Totally professional and re-assuring attention from start to finish.

author: Cole91
title: I absolutely recommend this type of care
body:
I wanted to leave a review on the care I have received through my pregnancy and labour.  
This is my second pregnancy and in comparison with my first pregnancy I was fortunate enough to have the same midwife Lisa for all my antenatal appointments and birth of my son.  
Giving the current circumstances and restrictions in place for labouring and birthing partners I was able to have a midwife that I knew and trusted with me in the early stages of labour. This had such a positive impact for me and I was lucky enough that Lisa was on shift when I went into labour.  
This massively reduced the worry I had felt about labouring on my own until my partner could be with me and giving that these restrictions may be in place for some time I think it would be extremely beneficial for any pregnant lady to receive consistent care from the same midwife through pregnancy and labour when possible as it can be quite a vulnerable time for any lady and I know it can be quite anxious to think that you cannot have a birthing partner until you are in active labour. I was really anxious to leave my partner knowing it may be hours or longer until I would be able to get support from him however having Lisa look after me eliviated that stress.  
Lisa has also been part of my aftercare and has visited me on two of my appointments which again i was not expecting as I am not in her catchment area but having the same midwife who delivered your baby also doing your aftercare and understands any questions or concerns I might have has made my experience so positive.  
I understand that this is something that is being piloted at the moment and it has been luck that I have gotten the same consistent care through my pregnancy and labour but I absolutely recommend this type of care and I don't feel I would have had such a positive experience without it.

author: Johnjohn
title: Ward 32
body:
I was admitted to ward 32 in March at 07.40. By 08.00 I was prepared for my heart surgery bloods grouped medication taken and ready for opp. The Staff were very courteous and kind, I was well informed and updated by my Named Nurse. The Registrar came to see me and the consent form was signed. I was due to go into theatre approx 13.00. Unfortunately due to the Covid 19 the surgery was cancelled at 15.40 the Registrar was outstanding as were the Nurses and Health Care staff they all showed compassion and were very helpful. I cannot praise the Staff anymore for their proffesional approach in my care on the Day and without doubt it makes me feel confident and at ease when I re visit for my surgery. I have been kept informed at all times by the Secretary of Mr Kannani and Surgery is planned shortly.  
Well done to all at ward 32 James Cook outstanding care.

author: Adolf
title: Returning back to health after coronavirus
body:
For myself i only had flu like symptoms and have made a fairly quick return to full health but my wife required hospital treatment at the Borders General Hospital. On her eventual release from hospital the local home care team swung into action by visiting morning and evenings, giving us all the support we required with aids, such as a wheeled walker, a komode and a handy wheeled shelved trolley.  
Physiotherapy and o/t persons also visited to assess our every day living and got a second bannister fitted on our stairs and support rails in the shower.  
Through this help with assisted showering, confidence boosting support and aids to help with everyday living, both my wife and myself are back to normal living and confident moving around the house and in the outside world again.

author: Jessiewessie32
title: Treatment
body: My husband had an abscess on his scrotum which needed packing and dressing on a daily basis. The district nurse service called 5 times, 3 different nurses, during his treatment. They were all very polite, very knowledgeable and gave real care to him. It was a very embarrassing time for my husband but they made him feel at ease and confident. They arrived at the time they said they would with all the equipment they needed. They even took the time to telephone him before they arrived so he had time for a shower. I cannot rate the service and care we both received highly enough. Thank you so much, he is 90% recovered now.

author: Emmerdale
title: Level of Care
body:
I was recently hospitalised after a heart attack and was eventually taken to the Day Case Unit at the RIE for an angiogram and 3 stent implants.  
I am in awe of the high level of care I received and the dedication and professionalism of the Doctors and Nurses who looked after me. Nothing was too much trouble, my questions were answered and, although a traumatic experience, I was put at ease at all time.  
I would like to express my sincere thanks, and those of my family, for all that was done for me. (PS I am well on the road to recovery).

author: Kat87
title: A credit to the profession and thank you!!!
body:
Went into the RAH maternity unit first week in May for an elective section and can’t praise the staff enough. From those on the ward prior to section to the very reassuring surgeon (Mr Thompson I think) and then to the postnatal ward... the care was exceptional. Particular mention to one of the student midwives on the postnatal ward.. Rosa I think... who was fantastic. Reassuring, caring and nothing was a bother. A credit to the profession and thank you!!!  
I ended up back in ward 31B due to feeding problems a few days later. This time looked after by midwife Emily. Again I can’t say thank you enough for all your care and reassurance. I was upset about being back in hospital and could have felt cut off in side room. But Emily checked in every couple of hours to see how the feeding was going throughout night and offered to help in anyway she could. Even popped in to say goodbye in morning before her shift was over. You honestly made my night back in so much more bearable.  
You would never have known about the situation going on with COVID and staff were truly fantastic!!  
Thank you to you all!!!

author: melissag11
title: Pre natal care
body:
I'm a first time mum and always had a fear of giving birth although I really really always wanted to be a mum, so I've never asked any of my friends/family about their birth stories or watched any of the programmes related, so my husband and I were completely clueless. In the initial probably 15 weeks we felt really let down after things being cancelled, not being told when I had an infection detected after sample, midwives repeatedly forgetting to give me the jabs they said I had to get, midwives changing and generally just feeling like we didn't know whether we were coming or going.  
The 3rd midwife (& thankfully the last 1) was Kirstie based in Udston Hospital Hamilton, and I cannot praise her enough. Through every appointment the care, friendliness and professionalism shown to us was amazing. I didn't have the easiest pregnancy but she was with me every step of the way and nothing was ever a problem for her. And then with the covid situation nothing changed (other than the mask) she was still amazing and even more reassuring given the worry I had with going to deliver during this time. Kirstie is a true asset and she is made for the job, even after having our baby girl she has been amazing with making sure we had everything sorted as we were changing areas so it got a bit complicated, but she didn't need to help us with this but she did off her own back. Kirstie I can't thank you enough for everything and I will never forget the care you gave me and how you made me feel

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: Mummymcdee
title: Midwife amazing care
body: I just want to commend my midwife Lorna from the Blue Team at Royal Alexandria Hospital she gave me amazing care through my pregnancy even through lockdown she was great with myself and newborn. Such a credit to the nhs.

author: Rainbow3
title: Fabulous Care in ECU
body: My elderly father in law was admitted to ECU at UHW and was treated for a Urinary Infection. Just wanted to thank the staff in ECU for looking after him so well. He was treated with kindness and dignity by every member of staff. It was especially thoughtful of Linzi and Jessica to arrange for him to have a face time call with us. He was so pleased to be able to see us while we talked.   In these challenging times with restricted visiting, we felt staff went above and beyond to make sure we could keep in touch. Happy to say he is now at home and feeling well.   Thank you all ☺️

author: ST88
title: Maternity labour care
body: I have just had my baby in the current pandemic and was very anxious about my hospital delivery. The staff at the Queen Elizabeth maternity unit were so amazing! They were calm, supportive and you would never have known that theit was anything different going on once in the labour suit and recovery ward! So happy to have had such a great bunch of midwife's looking after me and my newborn baby.

author: RMC85
title: Maternity unit during lockdown
body:
I was in Wishaw maternity unit in April, I arrived at 8am for a planned induction as i was 41 +5. I was worried and scared, due to the ongoing covid19 situation i was expected to go in alone. I didn't want my partner not to be allowed in, how could i do this alone? I didn't know what to expect regardless of my wonderful midwife putting my mind at ease, this wasn't going to help. So as I walked up to the doors and said my good byes I went into the ward.  
I was shown my bed, it was by a window I was so thankful for a window. I was overwhelmed with sadness as I was now alone. After I had a moment (they must have Known) I was fine. The ward held four beds, each midwife, nurse and auxiliary staff member came to say their hellos and this really helped me massively, I didn't feel like I was alone anymore.  
We quickly started the process, I was put on the monitors and everything was explained to me what will happen. So I got comfortable, I was safe and being looked after. Everything went well and the pessary was placed and now it was time for the wait.  
You could tell that the staff was overwhelmed due to the new rules, pending threat of the virus and colleagues being off, however, don't take my words negatively, their care for me was never rushed, never lacked and they were always cheerful and happy to talk to me. They were at the beginning of a very unusual time, something we have never dealt with the likes before.  
I got a lovely lunch and dinner, all the time I was looked after and informed as to what was happening. I remember one midwife as she shared a name with my late gran Elsie she was just lovely, but everyone was.  
I settled in thinking I was in for the night, however, I started to feel uncomfortable around 8 and I was given paracetamol without hesitation. As the contractions got further along I was given more pain killers as required. I was really sore but had maxed out on what I could have at around 1ish, this was time for the bath. Normally I love baths, I was reluctant as I was sore and couldn't think of anything worse. They convinced me to take one, it wasn't so bad, in fact it took my mind off it momentarily, however, I felt ill and had to come out.  
It was time to examine me and thankfully I was a couple of cm, and not long after that I was 5cm. I was so happy I was getting my partner back. So I was helped along the hall and taken into this huge birthing room. It was so clean, organized, I felt safe and my partner was now rushing over to meet me. I had a lovely midwife in with me keeping me sane.  
She had me rigged up with the gas and air in no time and was monitoring me. I was offered the holy grail the epidural, and I accepted.  
My partner was there, the atmosphere was relaxed (other than the pain of the contractions), I was even offered to have my drinks put in the fridge to keep them cool. This small little act was above what I expected I was so happy.  
The anaesthetist showed up, this bit was a bit of a blur my contractions were strong and close together, however, after I got my jag. As we were about to get started with my epidural unfortunately he was called away to an emergency section. I was fine, someone else needed it more, because he wasn't long out the room when I needed to push!  
I still feel I need to appologized for my awful language during contractions, but everyone was just so lovely took it in their stride.  
At 7:44am my daughter was born 8lb 3oz 65cm a perfect tiny girl.  
I got my skin to skin, we spent time staring at her. The midwives were just amazing, it was over I wasn't in any more pain. In our room, our perfect bubble you wouldn't know we were at the start of a lockdown, a pandemic.  
The aftercare was super, we got the room for hours, we were fed and I got a shower. Then it was time to go home.  
The care I received was second to none, other than my partner not being there during induction you wouldn't know a pandemic was going on. You wouldn't notice any difference and this is down to the midwives, nurses and auxiliary staff. Their care was exceptional, they looked after one anxious first time mum and I am so grateful to every last one of them. My only regret is that I didn't retain names (my memory is the worst). My care I have received from Wishaw has been wonderful, they took care of my during previous miscarriages, scans and physio appointments. Everyone I have met or dealt with has been informative, helpful, kind and put me at ease. I have never felt rushed or forced into any unwanted decisions. I would highly recommend the whole department to anyone who is expecting or planning.  
Thank you, you are all super heroes. I wanted to send flowers but my order was cancelled due to the restrictions. I hope my story, my experience is enough to let you know how grateful I really am, my whole family is.. Thank you!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: F Col
title: Maternity care during lockdown
body: I gave birth to my daughter, in the RAH Paisley at the beginning of April 2020. As a first time mum, being induced and giving birth during the corona virus pandemic was understandably very daunting, especially knowing my husband would only be present during active labour. I was overwhelmed by the exceptional level of care I received at RAH maternity, from midwives, doctors, health care assistants to cleaners- all the staff were incredibly kind and attentive. Due to complications we stayed for 4 nights and then again were readmitted 3 weeks later. I can't thank all the staff for everything they did to look after us, they went above and beyond to ensure we were so very well looked after. Thank you!

author: Sabi
title: Excellent staff made a difficult situation manageable
body:
My husband was admitted to Borders General Hospital during the Covid crisis with a severe urinary tract infection, as it turned out. He was in a covid assessment ward until tested negative. The hospital staff kept me well informed throughout his stay with the doctors phoning me after ward rounds. This was an excellent practice that should continue after the present crisis as it is often impossible to speak to doctors during normal visiting.  
He was discharged as soon as he was able with Home Care to complete his recovery. The Hawick Team of 7 staff, an OT and a PT were very professional and supportive to both my husband and I. He required their support for several weeks for personal care and mobility. The delivery of the necessary aids was organised by them and they were promptly delivered.  
As a couple in our mid 70's it would have been very hard for me to have coped with all that was required on his return from hospital. This may be a new service but in my opinion the excellent staff made a difficult situation manageable and are to be commended.

author: Kiddy 60
title: Our NHS is an understandable envy of the world
body:
I had an accident where I broke my toe and after phoning 111 I attended the Victoria hospital in Kirkcaldy later that day. I had my foot x ray’d and strapped and received an invitation by mail within 2 days for an appointment for a check up the following day. The consultant reviewed my foot and x rays and suggested surgery to fit a wire into my toe to help re align the bone to knit correctly; which he confirmed within 30 minutes was arranged for the following Monday at the minor surgery day care dept.  
I have been fortunate enough not to have to attend a hospital for anything other than visiting friends or relations for over 30 years, so it’s fair to say I was apprehensive prior to the appointment. I needn’t have been concerned, as the staff were all fantastic.  
Having turned up at 7:45 for registration, I was in theatre by 9:30, out by 10 and discharged around 12 noon, aided by the fact that the surgeon recommended at my pre op discussion that the op could quite easily be done under local rather than general anaesthetic. Not exactly what I wanted to hear, as my apprehension was Initially suppressed by the thought that I would be completely unaware of events in surgery, which would now not be the case. It’s now 24 hours post op and while my mobility is somewhat curtailed, I am in no discomfort whatsoever, and believe my convalescence will be short and lead to a completely successful operation. I can’t thank all the staff at the hospital enough for their attention, assistance and professional dealings with me, in particular Andy and Alison who I think were the staff nurses in the day intervention area, John, who kept me calm on the short journey to and from theatre from the day bay, and to Mr Annan, the surgeon who performed the operation on my toe. And my gratitude also extends to Alison ? the assistant anaesthetist who was a big calming influence on me during the operation.  
Thank you all.  
The experience has only reinforced the reputation In my mind that our NHS is an understandable envy of the world and quite simply a superb service from a dedicated, trusted and enthusiastic group of people. I appreciate and a knowledge that there are a large group of people who operate in the background to support the few names I have mentioned above, and they too should be extremely proud of the work they do on a day to day provision that just delivers.  
So just a big Thanks to everyone from a very appreciative recipient of your service

author: ahyes
title: My appreciation for the response to my calls
body: This is a simple story, no drama.   I called 111 for advice about serial vomiting.   My information was carefully noted and relevant questions asked of me.   Later I had the promised call from a clinician.   I thought I was better but after a relapse I called 111 again.   Once more I received careful attention.   The clinicians proved too occupied to call me this time within a reasonable time so what I particularly appreciated was a call from 111 at midnight to tell me that and ask if I wanted to cancel my request to talk with one, so that I could go to bed.   I  cancelled, but with a warm feeling of thanks.

readBy.name: South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

author: Emc88
title: Giving birth during lockdown
body:
I just want to thank all the midwifes/staff/cleaners at the RAH in paisley. From when I went in on my own to be induced they were fantastic. You wouldn't know there was a global pandemic going on. They made you feel very safe and welcoming.  
I was given great care by Terri up in the ward and then when I went to labour ward I had the lovely Kenny and a student midwife called Jen. I cant thank them enough for all their help and keeping me calm!  
The whole maternity section are second to none at the RAH and have been incredible throughout this pandemic keeping us mums safe and calm!

author: Mummymcdee
title: Hypnobirthing classes
body: I attended Elizabeth's hypnobirthing classes at Royal Alexandra Hospital with my partner in Feb 2020. The classes were amazing so helpful in preparing for birth and Preparing for life with my baby. Elizabeth is an amazing midwife such a caring lady and she genuinely cared for us making sure that we had the knowledge to confidently birth; I always felt 100% better and more confident after each class. What a lovely lady she is a credit to the nhs I was very lucky to meet her.

author: Sdoh1
title: Thanks ladies you made my experience truly amazing
body: My midwives, Sharon and Kirsty were honestly the best midwives I could have asked for. They were always supportive and were there for me every step of the way. Was like I had known them for years. It's so sad you only get to see them briefly after your baby is born. I would have loved to have had them a bit longer. They done an amazing job and I wish I could thank them in a more personal way. Thanks ladies you made my experience truly amazing.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: GlasgowT23
title: Neurology Appointment Difficulty
body:
I am due to attend an annual review with neurology, however I have had a lot of difficulty with getting a suitable date for these appointments.  
I work away from home on a fixed rota, and when I am given a new date these often fall on dates I am away from home. When I call to explain, I am usually told that the appointments are now full for several months. I'm aware that the Covid situation has made this even more difficult, and I appreciate that. But my appointment has now been pushed back to next year which means I won't have been seen for nearing 2 years.  
The issue I find is that it's not a case of organising a date that works for both parties, it's a case of being given a date and seemingly being penalised for not being able to attend that date due to work commitments.

author: Natyc68
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I didn't feel stupid
body: I gained access to Six Degrees through my GP. My therapist really made me feel listened to and not like I was been stupid, which is exactly how I felt at the time. She was really lovely, I felt I could get things off my chest. If I needed to use the service again I would without a doubt.

author: Natyc68
title: Stressful Situations
body:
I do have to say that the service i received from the therapists at Six Degrees has taught me to cope with stressful situations! Also not to dwell on things. I had been seeing a therapist for the 1st 4 sessions the the last 2 i had another therapist, but this did not affect the service i received and felt it had been a smooth transition to the new therapist who had been given all my information. I did not then have to go over everything again which really helped.  
Even just to receive a follow up call after my treatment had ended has really helped just knowing they still care for that i am grateful thank you.

author: RMC85
title: My midwife, our friend and rock
body:
Our midwife from Bellshill Medical Centre was amazing, we loved her, to say we will miss her is and was an understatement. She was friendly, open, honest and everything and more to us.  
I had two previous miscarriages, one was a missed miscarriage and required that i have surgery so I was very anxious and nervious with my current pregnancy. Our orginal midwife was leaving Bellshill medical center and she was replaced I had a couple of temporary midwifes at the first few visits (who were all great also) but then we got assigned to Alana.  
From the first appointment we knew she was going to be great. She chatted away to us, she was just so warm and welcoming. No question was stupid and she explained everything thoughtfully and thoroughly that we always walked away feeling safe.  
During my pregnancy my late gran had taken ill, the night before an appointment I was told she might not make it. I attended my appointment the next day and broke down when asked how I was. Alana was just so lovely and caring that it helped me more than she knows. That was the first day we heard our little ones heart beat for the first time.  
On every visit we learned something new, Alana allowed my partner to feel the babys head and showed him where baby was sitting. This involvement was precious to him, he treasured it and was excited for more appointments. All my questions and worries were met with a smile.  
On my last couple of visits at the start of lockdown, Alana was absent, I was told she was ill. We later found out she had covid19, she told us her story, she battled it exactly by the book. It showed how at risk our NHS staff really are sadly. She fell ill and self isolated in her home, one room and ensuite for two weeks. No contact with her family or outside world, all the while feeling terrible and getting food delivered to the door. It just hammered home what was going on and how close it was and is to us. Her story is why its important to follow guidelines she shouldnt have been at risk but was sadly.  
In the meantime our temporary midwives looked after us. They were great but not Alana, however, we had our beautiful daughter and Alana was back on visits we were chuffed.  
On our first day/night home we had a hard time with getting our girl to feed. She had a very fast delivery and was very mucousy. This resulted in her being sick and bringing it up constantly. She was born in the morning, fed once at hospital but nothing since so we phoned the hospital in worry that she wasnt feeding. We were hit with a bit of negativity which shocked us due to the exceptional treatment I had had previously. We felt we had let down our daughter, guilty, that we were failures. We told Alana the next day, she instantly put us at ease. She explained that she was fine, we did nothing wrong, as baby was full of mucus she wouldnt be hungry untill it cleared. She was perfectly fine, just give her time and she will be the milk monster that she is.  
We looked forward to our visits with Alana she answered all our questions again putting our first time anxiety on the back burner and lifted us up with a new found confidence. With everyl ittle worry she was able to explain what was causing the worry, what was happening and that everything was normal.  
I remember from previous visits to her before baby I was due injections to prevent clots that I was to self administer, however, I didnt get any. I said this to her and she confirmed guidelines had changed and that might be why I didnt get them. She however didnt just leave it there she followed it up and found that there was an unfortunate error. She then the next day brought everything to me and showed me what to do. She was so thorough, always caring and nothing was overlooked.  
She always told us to contact her over anything, one night I was so worried, I had passed a large clot. I messaged her, not expecting a reply till the next day, however, I got contacted back right away and my mind was put at ease once again. That was above and beyond.  
The sad day came our last visit from Alana and we were so sad to see her go, she really was our rock. She had helped us with silly things like how to bath baby, up to what to do if there is a major issue. She took two first time parents filled with nervousness and anxiety and left us with pride and confidence. She built us up and for this no words can properly describe just how thankful we really are. The care we received was exceptional and shes another hero and major asset of the NHS. Thank you Alana, you will be seriously missed and I hope your other patients treasure you as we have.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: WatermelonPonies
title: A doctor
body:
I was recently in a&e/cdu (I cant remember which was exactly as was brought in by ambulance and was taken straight through because of Covid)  
I was seen very promptly which was fab in itself. I then had the pleasure of talking to the kindest doctor named Rosie (I believe she was a doctor - in black scrubs!)  
The first thing she did was reassure me about the fact everyone was wearing face masks/aprons/gloves because of covid.  
I was in hospital because of my suicide attempt & suicidal ideation. Rosie listened to me, and I mean really listened. She payed attention, let me speak and made me feel comfortable. She didn’t make me feel like she was in a rush or that she had better things to do with her time. She didn’t mind sitting in silence when I couldn’t find the words. Rosie encouraged me to stay for the psych team to see me and see what help I could get which I was very reluctant to do having had previous bad experiences but she offered to sit with me when they came (unfortunately this couldn’t happen because her shift ended before they came) and reminded me that not everybody is the same, and this might just be the one time I get somewhere.  
She also checked in on me often even when she was busy and encouraged me to have something to eat and drink despite not wanting to. I was very upset and incredibly tired at the time and I just want to tell Rosie just how grateful I am for the way you treated me. You are by far the best a&e doctor I have had when I have been in for my mental health. I hope that others follow your lead and treat patients with the same calm, attentive attitude. Thank you so much Rosie. Without you I wouldn’t have stayed in hospital that night.

author: Thankyou18
title: From the minute we entered the service was outstanding
body:
My 8 year old daughter fell and had a nasty deep cut on her head. I rushed her to A& E at Hairmyres Hospital, East Kilbride and from the minute we entered the building the service was outstanding. The reception staff were friendly and welcoming and we were immediately shown to a nearby waiting area after we had registered.  
After only a few minutes, my daughter was being triaged by a lovely nurse, who put her at ease and calmed her down. 5 minutes later we were with an amazing Doctor Palombo. He was amazing with my daughter and treated her with great care and compassion. He was very attentive and took great care to try and reduce any scarring, while treating the wound effectively.  
We were given information to take away to read on head injuries so I knew what warning signs to look out for, also extra wound dressings, with clear instructions on what to do over the next few days. It was less than 60 minutes from entering the building to leaving. I can’t thank all of the staff at Hairmyres enough!

title: my opinion of my care at Church St, Bishops…
body: I have been with church st surgery for over 35 years and every doctor I've seen there have been superb, Extremely professional yet friendly and approachable. I am 63 and the reason I am in as good health as I am is directly attributable to the care I've been given by the doctors in this surgery, and the nurses. In fact I feel that strongly about this surgery that it is one of the three main reasons I will not move out of the area. They have always given prompt diagnosis and treatment Their caring attitude has always been present no matter who I have seen.

author: P155OFF
title: This doctor hadn't taken time to read my partner's notes
body:
Other half admitted with bacterial infection. Put on file a DNR notice without consulting with family before hand. (She has MS) Only learned about it the following day. Requested that it be removed from file or a note applied to cancel it.  
Was given a excessively graphic description of the resus process to persuade me to conform.  
In the past, I've had to put up with threatening behaviour from a consultant who boxed me in with 2 junior doctors and spent 10 minutes verbally abusing me. This doctor hadn't even taken time to read my partner's notes. Had another doctor who seemed not to be able to tell a hand from a foot from an x-ray. Food is crap because they do not cook it properly.

author: Lilianmay
title: Operation to repair right wrist
body: I attended the Day Intervention Unit atVictoria Hospital Kirkcaldy in May as a day patient for repair to my broken right wrist. From the moment I arrived until left later that afternoon the care, courtesy and attention of all the medical staff was superb. I was attended in the ward by Julie and Alison and despite being run off their feet, their care and attention did not waver. They took care of all their patients with care and kindness at all times. I cannot praise them enough. Thank you ladies. 🌈🌈🌈🌈

author: Kirsty1107
title: Weekly Phone Calls From Hospice
body: My mum receives a weekly call from Cathrine the chaplain at the hospice and makes my mums week. She says Cathrine puts things into perspective for her and really helps just by chatting and listening to my mum. My mum feels like they have known each other for years how comfortable Cathrine makes her feel. I feel Cathrine really goes over and above what we would have expected for support after my dads passing.

title: Exceptional
body: This is a genuinely patient-focused practice. And very efficient. The preventive aspects of their work are impressive. The practice is now, cautiously and carefully, resuming some of their normal workload post Covid 19. I feel lucky to live within a stone's throw of the Best in Bath!

title: Very good overall
body:
I have been a patient at this practice for many years, one of the reasons we remain in this area. 
My most recent experience is when they are working under high pressure and In a difficult times. My medical concern was listened to and responded to very well by the doctors. 
The reception staff also responded well in a friendly manner when I was making appointments and to make a very brief visit to hand something in. 
It has taken time for the the new team to bed in but I am grateful to have this practice in our area, we have been fortunate overall in having good doctors down the years. Thank you to the current team, especially now, their efforts are appreciated.

title: Amazing staff Ward 33C.
body: My husband was on the ward throughout April.  Staff were amazing and at a time when we could not visit him to keep his moral up and support him, the staff certainly did this.  They were exceptional in their care and understanding and worked under difficult times during Covid 19.  Thank you for the love and care, x

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Isolation high risk
body: As I am high risk due to recently starting intravenous medication at the hospital. The practice telephoned myself and asked if I needed any support with shopping and prescriptions. Luckily my partner works in a supermarket and has gone onto nights to keep myself safe.  The practice was very supportive and also asked about my mental health

title: Great Service
body: Very Nice staff and very clean. I would recommend it to others. It is very big and hard to navigate but the staff are nice and it is well signposted.

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful reception and prescription staff
body: The receptionists and prescription service are amazing can not fault them or thank them enough, been with the same GP’s for many years. I have issue with one of the doctors, but the rest of the doctors and the nurses are outstanding.

title: Caring and understanding practice
body:
We have been registered patients at Denton Medical for 80 years plus between us, seen the surgery keep crossing Ashton Road over the years, until, what was a purpose surgery built, and where it stands today.

I would like to take the opportunity at this time, whilst we're all going throughout the strangest of times, the  Lockdown 2020 Pandemic .

It would be unfair to single out one member of staff, as you are a huge team of healthcare professionals, from the reception staff, back office admin staff, nurses, doctors, and not forgetting the cleaners.

We are always treated with courtesy, dignity, and empathy when needed, feel listened to, and above all, as we are the only patient you have seen today, which obviously we aren't.

A big thank you from us, for all that you do for our community.

Diane & Anthony Welsh

title: On line website
body: Unable to secure consultation or request prescriptions! The website questions were not relevant to my needs

title: Superb
body:
Incredibly impressed with the professionalism and caring approach of everyone at the department, not to mention the expertise of those carrying out my minor procedure. Not only that, the whole experience was speedy and stress- free —  from initial diagnosis at 9 am, I left a free man at 11 am. This is extremely good in any circumstance, but the fact that we are all in the midst of a pandemic makes this truly extraordinary.
Four days on, my wound is healing very nicely, more evidence of good practice I think. Grateful thanks to all involved.

title: Fantastic Service
body: I cannot commend Latham House highly enough.  I had an appointment for a blood test for my 12 year old son today and despite the enormous amount of pressure the service is currently under we were treated in the most friendly and courteous way. The service was incredibly efficient and felt very safe.  The blood test was carried out quickly and I was able to stand close to the door so as to observe distance and also be within eyesight of him whilst he had his blood test. He also commented that it didn't really hurt!  Thanks to all the lovely staff at Latham House

title: Outstanding care and service
body:
I had the misfortune to crash my car in the surgery car park, damaging another car in the process.
It happened that one of the Doctors was in the car park at the time. He could not have been more considerate or caring. Having checked I was not physically hurt he took me in to the Surgery and brought me a cup of hot sweet tea in case I had delayed shock.
The admin team then took over: in particular the Reception Manager who likewise could not have been more helpful and considerate. She continued her help throughout the day - not least with site problems getting the breakdown truck to remove the wrecked car.
The next morning my own GP even took the trouble to telephone to see how I was.
Thank you everyone - typical of the first class, friendly and caring service I have always received at St. Pauls

title: Thank you
body: Thank you to all the staff in the emergency eye clinic for the care and attention I received this morning. Much appreciated in these difficult times!

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care
body: I would like send special thanks to the nurse who spoke to my husband and myself at around 5 am on 19th May. My husband was in a state of high anxiety and the nurse was so calm, caring, professional and understanding. She managed to talk my husband down from his anxious state and provided reassurance and support of the highest quality. I can't thank her enough for her invaluable help. She really made a huge difference!

title: Great home from home
body:
My mother was resident there until her death in March. She received fantastic care during the three years on onars she was there. Attentive , caring staff always  on hand. Very lucky to have found such a special place for my mother. Highly recommended
Special place for my mother.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: BRILLIANT RESPONSE TO COVID-19
body: The actions the surgery has taken during Covid-19 to keep us all safe has been brilliant! Patients have been kept fully up-to-date regarding services available during Covid-19 and clear, concise information which has been appreciated. Thank you for all your hard work, stay safe and be kind to yourselves.

title: Fantastic staff
body: Absolutely brilliant outpatients department  and hospital, from surgery to the present couldn't ask for a better experience be treated like a human is lovely with a caring and compassionate

title: Ultrasound scan
body:
My appt was at the Harold Wood practise and on entering my temperature was taken which reassured me during this difficult time
The premises were clean and welcoming
My appt was on time and I was treated kindly and professionally
Overall a very good experience

title: Exceptional service
body:
The service you receive is always first rate. I called late afternoon to make an appointment to see a doctor and was asked if it would be ok for a doctor to call the following morning if not to come to the hub that evening.
I decided to have the call.
Duly at 8.30 the doctor called and asked if I could come in at 10.30.
I was assessed and and blood tests and ECG were carried out immediately to my complete satisfaction.
I have been under this practice all my life, but the care and dedication of all the staff since it has been AT medics has been incredible.

title: Terrible repeat prescription service
body: For over the past year, my prescription from Longcroft has been incorrect with every month, at least one item missing when I visit my local Boots.  I have complained but there is no improvement.  Some items are vital to my everyday health, but it makes no difference.

title: Exceeding expectations
body: I have had to contact the surgery a few times during the current situation and they are answering the phone straight away and have been very helpful. I was made to feel very comfortable and looked after when I attended my appointment. Thank you.

title: Social Distancing
body: I recently attended a routine ultrasound test which went very well. I was however astounded at the lack of social distancing among the staff in the corridors. It was as if there were multiple social gatherings going on and hardly a mask in sight. I felt very uncomfortable. Maybe all had tested negative but this is a point in time test.I now fully understand why people may feel nervous about attending appoinments.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Rubbish and no help
body: My partner has pathological demand avoidance on the autism spectrum so before we attended we called to ensure I (her partner & carer), and were told that would be fine. However when we arrived and they came for her and said I couldn't come in. After explaining to them her difficulties I still wasn't able to enter because the re were too many people in the room. I've attended my mums scans in the past and there was only ever 1 ultrasound technician so why the need for so many people? After she came out she was in floods of tears due to the stress of being alone with all the strangers, and there was in fact only 1 technician... I can't stress my disappointment and frustration enough. There was nothing done to accommodate her autism or communication difficulties at all. Not happy in the slightest with what happened.

title: So helpful
body: My 23 year old daughter arrived last night having been referred to see the maxfax surgeon by Hillingdon Hospital. She had an abscess inside her mouth which she’d had for 2 weeks . A gp or dentist wouldn’t help her so A&E was our last resort. She was treated with care and respect by all staff and moved very quickly through the system . The surgeon who she said was wonderful was able to treat her on this visit by draining the abscess and giving intravenous painkillers and a prescription for antibiotics. She had been terrified when entering the department as she’s never been to hospital before and as guidelines require at this present time I could not go with her . Thank you to all the staff for being there when I couldn’t and for putting her on the road to recovery, she is much better today .

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Amazing staff
body: I have needed to use the early pregnancy services this week despite fearing the worse everything has been ok with the help and support from the staff at the early pregnancy unit I cannot thank them enough for their care the nurse scanning me was amazing calm and dealt with such an emotional scary situation in a perfect professional way making me feel at ease and despite not been able to have my partner their as the current situation I still felt supported by the team doing what they could to help me using all the right percusions to help keep us all safe. Just what to say thank you for what you are doing and despite things been harder the care and help was still amazing.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Caring staff
body:
My wife and I have been patients at the Slaidburn Health Centre for nearly forty years and the attention to detail from all the staff is highly professional and exemplary. From the Doctor to the Nurse, practice manager and receptionist they have the patients health and well being at heart and nothing is too much trouble.  
  In our isolated rural location, we consider ourselves extremely fortunate to have the health centre which is a great asset to the Hodder Valley  and one which maintains extremely high standards and a friendly atmosphere. Well done to you all.

title: Good practice
body: The doctors I have spoken to have helped me immensely. I have had bad experiences with other practices and this is the first that has listened to me and taken my condition seriously. Thanks to my Dr I am finally going somewhere with my treatment.

title: Really good service!!
body: Brilliant, quick, safe, clean, tidy! Made my daughter relax and not worry or stress too much about what was going to happen x

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: I am so impressed by the service of St Helliers
body: From the time I arrived at St Helliers, to the time I left, I had the very best care possible. The surgeons, anesthetics, nurses theatre staff everyone, was so friendly and caring. I could not of had such care anywhere else. They all showed proffessional care, with information aswell as being so supportive. Im now in after care where my appointments were made and my on going care explained for the future. I would highly recommend St Helliers to all my friends and family. Please pass on my thanks Debbiexxxx

title: The worst reception and phone staff I have ever…
body: The reception staff and those ladies that answer the phone need to go on some sort of training. They show total disregard for patients and their needs. You will not encounter any empathy, understanding or humanity here. I also raised a complaint months ago for similar bad treatment, which was under investigation and then nothing happened. Every time I deal with this practice, whether in person or by phone, I leaving feeling less than human.

title: Quick and Thorough
body:
I received a quick response when I emailed Compass House with details and photos of my symptoms.  The Lead Advanced Nurse Practitioner was thorough in his questions and explanations and his final diagnosis without actually seeing me was spot on. He prescribed antibiotics that I was able to pick up from my preferred pharmacist within the hour and by day two I was feeling a whole lot better!
I contacted the practice by email as I regard the appointment system as with all GP surgeries quite unworkable.  With everyone required to phone between certain hours in the morning means you may have to try several mornings before getting an appointment.  Daft when you want to prebook an appointment for some time in the future.  It blocks the line for those who need to see a doctor immediately.  There should be more pre-bookable appontments available to book at any time, but which are open to postponement in cases of emergency.  The difficulties in phoning for an appointment just means people put off seeing a doctor until the conditon becomes more serious and then more difficult and expensive to deal with!

title: Extremely helpful
body: My mum is visiting us from abroad and she ran out of medication due to her unplanned extended stay in the country because of no return flights back home. We rang the partnership in the morning and by mid-afternoon she already received her medication. A huge thank you to all the staff at the partnership. Much appreciated.

title: Outstanding District Nurse Care
body:
Having recently received care for my Father, I cannot thank the support, care and treatment my father received. Especially during these difficult times. 
The team are a credit to the NHS and the nursing profession.

title: Outstanding palliative care
body:
My mother was in Ealing Hospital during its height of Covid-19 cases, a very busy time I’m sure. She passed away though, at the age of 95, not of Covid-19 but of other complications due to old age. 
At this busy time, a member of the Macmillan palliative care team provided hugely helpful advice in a very kind, patient and sensitive manner.
Being a link between us the family, and the doctors and nursing team, the person kept us up to date, gave us answers to various questions and offered a kindly sympathetic ear - all in a very professional manner.
We are very grateful for this person’s presence. It helped ease us through the whole process.
I hope whoever is in charge of the palliative care team is able to read this review and that it will be of reassurance to others who may have to go through a similarly difficult time.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Excellent service
body: Visited Purley War Memorial Hospital this afternoon for a blood test, as GP practice has no phlebotomist at present. I was pleasantly surprised at how quickly and efficiently I was seen, and although often there are problems extracting blood due to small veins, the lady who did my test today had absolutely no problem. Highly recommend.

title: Great service and friendly
body: I was not well on Thursday night i was very scared with 111 advice me to call my doctor the next day .my doctor call me and maid appointment for me today  thank you Francis Grove surgery

title: Individualised patient care
body:
Thank you to all the lovely staff that looked after my husband and I in A and E yesterday evening(21 05 2020)
My husband is severely disabled following a stroke in 2017. He has lost the ability to communicate easily with others. 
Unfortunately he had a fall at home yesterday injuring his shoulder. He was taken to A & E by Two , caring , professional, lovely paramedics. 
During these difficult times for the NHS I was so grateful that the staff showed such compassion to us regarding his status as a vulnerable adult.  The two lovely Ladies that carried out his admission paperwork, bloods and ECG treated us both with the utmost compassion and respect. Thank you. The nurse practitioner was caring, kept us well informed with the investigations required and the outcome of the results. The nurses that cared for us in the pod were also extremely caring and professional in their approach. 
Thank you to all of you. My husband and I really appreciated the individualised patient care that he received . We were both really relieved that he was able to be discharged home. 
Thank you all very much. 
Mary Chapman

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient and Caring
body: The staff at The Wilson Practice are outstanding. Even under the strain of coronavirus, they deliver speedy and efficient care. My experience started with the e-consultant service , which I used late one night to report an infection from an insect bite. The nurse responded first thing in the morning, by getting a prescription made up and hand delivered to the pharmacy so I could start the course of antibiotics straight away. Even when the pharmacy lost the paperwork, the receptionist and nurse both delivered sterling service to make a reprinted script available to me straight away. I honestly couldn’t have asked for more. From the frontline medical staff to those working in administrative or managerial roles - the team are simply superb.

title: General comments
body:
I am not a patient here. My 95 year old mother is. She has asthma and failing eye sight. She is registered disabled.  Some weeks ago I contacted Gold Street to request they put her on the Covid 19 vulnerable person register. This request was refused. I must own I find this decision strange. If she is not vulnerable who is?
I would also question the practicies policies regarding repeat prescriptions in the context of equable access. I was told on thursday by a receptionist (21/05/20) that the regular procedure for patients who did not have online access was that they had to visit the surgery in person every time they needed repeat prescription supplies. This policy would appear to disadvantage those (most likely older patients) who do not have internet contact. These are likely those patients who will also find visiting the surgery in person most difficult.
Perhaps this policy needs review in the context of equable service provision.

title: Great practice and helpful  staff
body: The doctors were amazing. I was sent to A&E unconscious and my doctor was able to  talk to my parents and update them. They were so understanding and explained everything calmly. I felt so reassured despite not remembering anything that happened. Amazing staff, I can’t express enough my gratitude to them, I have made sure to clap extra hard every Thursday and I wish I could do more.

title: Changes at surgery due to coronavirus
body: Due to the coronavirus pandemic the changes made at the surgery have been excellent.  You can phone up and a doctor will contact you, usually within the hour.  As a full time worker this service has proved invaluable.  No more waiting for an hour prior to opening to get a same day appointment, no sitting in a crowded waiting room where germs can be spread.  This really needs to be the considered as the new norm going forward.  Well done Donnybrook.

title: Poor personnel skills by telephone receptionist
body: Even though we knew this was a difficult time for the doctors we were surprised by the lack of patience by the telephone receptionist. She was more worried by the queue of waiting calls than really trying to help. It was basically get on line, report your problem and you may get a phone call today if not you would have to wait until Tuesday.

title: Very good practice
body: The doctor I saw was very caring , asked lots of as about my condition, and prescribed the appropriate medication which I am now taking,and which is being delivered by the local chemist, as I am in lockdown due to age.

title: Day case surgery
body:
would just like to say a BIG !! thank you to ALL staff who were dealing with my surgery on the 22/05/2020, so caring and i know you dont allow individual names to be mentioned, so i would"nt but the anesthetist was just such a nice guy, made me feel really relaxed, and the cosultants, and all the theatre staff as well, and nurses, thank you again,
steve brunton

title: Great service and helpful practice
body:
I inadvertently threw away some boxes of my usual medication. I take several different types of pills.Due to Covid 19 I have been self isolating because I am in my late 70’s. I haven’t been outside for about 9 weeks and I think my brain is turning to mush!!
I requested a replacement prescription online last Thursday. By Friday afternoon the request had been approved by my GP gone onto my chemist and was delivered to my home! You can’t get better service than that with the NHS. Many, many thanks to all involved.

title: Great service and advice
body: Called this morning with eye infection ?  Advised to drive to the car park then phone  Called and then had return call asking me to come in Treated by a clinician who was very helpful and pleasant and who gave a script for antibiotic drops  Very quick and helpful visit  Thank you

readBy.name: Lincolnshire Community Health Services NHS Trust

title: Caring with confidence
body: I visited the Endoscopy Suite for a Colonoscopy. Because of the virus, extra precautions had to be taken. Everything was explained clearly to me at each stage. Every member of staff I engaged with was caring, professional and friendly. I was treated politely with kindness and respect throughout. I am extremely grateful to have been looked after my a wonderful team of people. I would not hesitate to recommend going here and would certainly be happy to visit again if necessary.

title: Great service for patients
body: We didn’t visit the hospital but telephoned. My mum is an outpatient and just before lockdown had problems getting her medication from our chemist as there were supply issues. I phoned Mfields and a pharmacist spoke to me and was going to consult a doctor and phone back, which they did. They then posted out a months medication. Excellent, professional service cannot be faulted in these difficult times. Then today, two months on my mum has had vision problems. I phoned and left a contact number. Despite reduced service someone contacted my mum within two hours and reassured her. Once again excellent service in challenging times. A big thank you to all staff on both occasions.

title: Terrific Service
body:
I’ve contacted the practice twice during the last two weeks and both times been called by a doctor within a few hours to discuss my issue. 

I’ve experienced recurring tinnitus and sinus pain. I was able to get a prescription for antibiotics initially, and then was recommended an over the counter nasal spray to relieve inflammation when the infection didn’t fully clear up. 

Both phone calls were pleasant and informative. Considering the incredible pressure medical professionals are under during the Covid19 outbreak I’ve been pleasantly surprised and impressed at the service I’ve received. Effective, timely and friendly staff and procedures. Thank you very much.
